name: Club
description: It may be crude, but it gets the job done.

name: Maul
description: At last, we will have revenge.

name: Brawler
description: For smashing faces and taking names.

name: The Broominator
description: For sweeping sidewalks and clearing cobwebs.

name: Blackjack
description: Hitting fifteen enemies is easy, but it really gets tricky deciding to hit on sixteen.

name: Bludgeon
description: Perfect tool when you need the enemy to experience "broke, blind, and bedlam."

name: Striped Club
description: When used as a scratching post, it brings out all the cats and kittens.

name: Night Club
description: Nothing good ever happens with this club after two in the morning, so be careful.

name: Fact Finder
description: Also known in some circles as the Stick of Enhanced Interrogation.

name: Knife Club
description: It's the most exclusive Knife in town.

name: Rage Maker
description: If you want to see this axe in full display, tell your wife that your mother's cooking is better.

name: Fury Bringer
description: Enthusiasts of this axe come from around the land to discuss cryptozoology and costume design.

name: Vengeance
description: This axe is fairly common, and is used mostly to settle grieveances.

name: Pride
description: Hard to know if this axe is noble or corrupt, but it looks really great.

name: Greedy Pickaxe
description: I'm not saying it's a gold digger, but it has been used in such activities in the past.

name: Slothslayer
description: Sloths don't move very fast, but they are mean and will bite.

name: Lusty Handaxe
description: Lore states that it belonged to a famous Argonian Maid.

name: Envy
description: Apply some venom the the edges of this axe, and you can turn your enemies green, with Envy.

name: Gluttonous Axe
description: Gluttonous Axe is not very balanced, and probably should lose some weight around the belly.

name: Wrath
description: This axe's name varies by region. In some places it is known as Crusade, and in others, Cataclysm.

name: Lonely Spear
description: If this spear comes for you, there could be one less lonely adventurer, so be careful.

name: Scary Spear
description: While it started out as a member in a group of spears, Scary has gone on to become a real X-factor.

name: Crazy Spear
description: Knowing too much about this weapon could lead to detrimental outcomes.

name: Intimidating Spear
description: It really is the sincerest form of flattery.

name: Moody Spear
description: A well-balanced spear, so long as it takes it's medication.

name: Shadow Spear
description: If you are going to use a spear, you would just enjoy it more if you knew no one else used it.

name: Lucky Spear
description: Sometimes being lucky is better than being good, but both are better than being alone.

name: Pickle Spear
description: A little salty, but it goes really well with tequila.

name: Alien Spear
description: Use this spear to destroy your enemies -- not to study, not to bring back, but to wipe them out.

name: Toxic Spear
description: Caution: do not keep many of these in one place.  The last thing you want is a Toxic Community.

name: Servant Rod
description: Customarily given by employers as a sign of gratitude and appreciation for years of service.

name: Envoy Rod
description: This rod is given to foreign dignitaries, as a sign of friendship and respect.

name: Actor Rod
description: Technically it's a Barista Rod, but as long as the dream is still alive, I guess it counts.

name: Officer Rod
description: Pranksters frequently put this rod in a gelatinous mold.

name: Manager Rod
description: It's not very functional or elegant, and it's output stinks.  Use it diligently.

name: Stewart Rod
description: Some rods have all the luck, and the Stewart Rod gets all the breaks.

name: Finicky Rod
description: It's very tricky to master and has a really confusing balance.

name: Funky Rod
description: Just as you hit an enemy, it's best to turn around and shout, "Lay down the boogie!"

name: Flashy Rod
description: This rod appears to be very powerful, but just below the surface, there isn't much substance.

name: Fishing Rod
description: Don't teach a man to fish, feed yourself.  Fishing isn't that hard.

name: Basic Wand
description: Interests include pumpkin spice, ugly boots, and yoga pants.

name: Forest Wand
description: Yelling "run" while using this wand, no matter how hilarious, is a cheap attempt at a joke.

name: Wind Wand
description: Wendy wondered when, or where, her wind wand wandered.

name: Soul Wand
description: Crafting this wand will give you great power, but it may cost you everything.

name: Rain Wand
description: The secret is the hidden compartment which houses the silver iodide.

name: Frozen Wand
description: If you can thaw a frozen wand, there may be no challenge you can't overcome.

name: Ocean Wand
description: It is similar to the Rain Wand, but has key elements that make it more powerful.

name: Thunder Wand
description: Speaking scientifically, it's probably lightning, but the person who named it wasn't that bright.

name: Hate Wand
description: Most wizards use this wand out of anger, which unsurprisingly leads to suffering.

name: Love Wand
description: Romantic comedies are right: trading in glasses for contacts counts as a total makeover.

name: Earth Staff
description: It's a dirty staff, but someone has got to use it.

name: Wind Staff
description: If you spin the Wind Staff quickly over your head, you won't fly, but it will look really cool.

name: Fire Staff
description: Street performers have been dazzling audiences for years using this special staff.

name: September Staff
description: Better than the Month of May Staff, that's for sure.

name: Water Staff
description: Expert water staff users can use floods in expertly timed, awe inspiring bursts of magic.

name: Heart Staff
description: Honestly the weirdest of the staves, and kind of a boring superpower.

name: Planet Staff
description: There aren't many of these to go around, so make sure you treat this one with care.

name: Lunar Staff
description: Possibly fake.  It casts an odd shadow.  Could be a movie studio knockoff.

name: Support Staff
description: Having somewhere between five and seven of these at all times is highly efficient.

name: Janitorial Staff
description: Janitorial Staves may be underappreciated, but befriend them early and often.

name: Knife
description: Even the mighty oak starts as a simple acorn.

name: Butter Knife
description: Check out the low calorie version -- Hard To Believe This Isn't A Butter Knife.

name: Kitchen Knife
description: I'm knifin around... cut, cut, cut, cut, cut.

name: Chef's Knife
description: Also known in some circles as Everybody's Grudge.

name: Fishing Knife
description: Named for the common technique of "Water Stabbing," which is the best way to catch a fish.

name: That's Not A Knife
description: Sure, a talking dog and a duck who refuses to wear pants is fine, but the weapon is breaking immersion.

name: That's A Knife
description: Some suggest that the original name is actually "This Is A Knife" -- they're wrong.

name: Club Knife
description: It's the most exclusive Club in town.

name: Dark Knife
description: One popular urban legend mentions that this blade is involved in fowl play.

name: The Bloopinator
description: This magical knife can slay overlords and tyrants, but using it comes with a price.

name: Shatterer
description: You can't fire arrows through a force field.  So, don't try it.

name: Fragmenter
description: Fire at a spine to deconcatenate the discs.  Reversing this process may take time.

name: Disintegrator
description: This bow is unlicensed.  I'd stand back if I were you.

name: Bone Breaker
description: No frills way of incapacitating an enemy combatant.

name: Fracture Finder
description: The perfect bow to use when precision is required.

name: Demolisher
description: A versatile bow, it damages all enemies and can be a big problem if left unchecked.

name: Shocker
description: Able to shoot two arrows at once, but be extremely careful.

name: Stunner
description: Don't anger Stunner, or it will open an eight million gold can of whoop and serve it to ya cold.

name: Splinterer
description: The legends say the owner of this bow trained renaissance painters to be ninjas and eat pizza.

name: Ruiner
description: I used to think arrow to the knee jokes were funny, but then I took an arrow to the knee.  Still not funny.

name: Riding Crop
description: Sometimes used as a weapon, more often it is utilized in horse racing.

name: Bull Whip
description: The favorite weapon of a world-class archaeologist.

name: Snake Whip
description: Given its name because of the shape it takes when coiled.

name: Cool Whip
description: This is a dish best served cold.

name: Readied Whip
description: A few years ago, this weapon's production was halted due to a deadly gas explosion.

name: Quirt
description: Quirts are used often for punishment rather than encouragement.

name: Qilinbian
description: The qilinbian is mostly used for exercise, but certain instructors can wield it with lethal force.

name: Sjambok
description: Traditionally made from hippopotamus or rhinoceros hides.

name: Cat O Nine Tails
description: This whip's name is a bit of a misnomer -- it's made from fox fur.

name: Shaped Whip
description: Try to detect this whip, not before it's too late, or else you'll get whipped good.

name: Meager Sword
description: Use it.  Abuse it.  Lose it.  That's the Meager Sword Motto.

name: Modest Sabre
description: It may not look like much, but it does the job.  Eventually.

name: Sailor Cutlass
description: Because what new sailors need is a heavy object that sinks.

name: Salty Sword
description: A weapon for the eternally angry and margarita fans alike.

name: Lakekeeper
description: The Lakekeeper may be a bit rusty, but a little tetanus never hurt anyone.

name: Buzzblade
description: Set this blade to stun, instead of kill, and have a blast.

name: Feverbreaker
description: It's hard to have a fever when your head is missing.

name: Balmungous
description: Having two or three of these in a group will make a giant difference.

name: Cannonballer
description: The favorite weapon of pirates and gunpowder enthusiasts.

name: Jawstriker
description: A blow to the jaw from this blade will do serious, long lasting damage.

name: Standard Helmet
description: A plain, standard issue helmet given to soldiers on their way to war.

name: Cobalt Helmet
description: This helmet is extremely heat resistant, but it is also highly magnetic.

name: Regular Helmet
description: It does a much better job of preventing brain injuries than a rusty bucket ever could.

name: Super Helmet
description: Be grateful that this one doesn't come with that super annoying regional lockout.

name: Mega Helmet
description: This reactive armor says it reduces damage by 93%, but it's probably just marketing hype.

name: Skull Helmet
description: Forged from the skull of a giant insect, this helmet smells like jerky and deception.

name: Dark Helmet
description: Crafting this helmet always feels like the first time, for the last time.

name: Whimsical Helmet
description: The ideal helmet for stunt performers and clowns alike.

name: Magnetized Helmet
description: The metal in this helmet has been altered at the molecular level.

name: Coal Helmut
description: The perfect head cover for mine shafts and reunification.

name: Simple Hat
description: As long as it covers my bald spot, I'm happy.

name: Princess Tiara
description: This tiara isn't for real princesses, but rather those who demand to be treated like one.

name: Black Hat
description: It also comes in "morally grey."

name: Beach Hat
description: This hat is perfect for summer days, where the sand is coarse, rough and irritating.

name: Green Bay Beret
description: It is made of foam, smells like beer, and comes with a warning against bears, vikings, and lions.

name: The Mind Cap
description: Concealed inside the lining is a healthy dose of tin foil, for obvious reasons.

name: Ornate Crown
description: Clearly overcompensating for something.

name: Spellcasting Hat
description: To awaken it's power, recite the following spell --  "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet"

name: Noble Tiara
description: Owners of these don't often mix with each other, because they're already stable.

name: All Folks Hat
description: As close to "one size fits all" as fantasy headwear can be.

name: Bandit Mask
description: The perfect disguise for robbing trains.

name: Hidden Mask
description: It matches your complexion perfectly.

name: Rubber Mask
description: Make sure to put the lotion on your skin before wearing this mask again.

name: Cucumber Mask
description: Put it into a jar with vinegar and salt to create a tasty snack.

name: Coffee Mask
description: Seemingly addictive, but comes with strange digestive complications.

name: Pumpkin Mask
description: Especially popular in autumn with Basic Wand users.

name: Stone Mask
description: The eyes in this mask seem droopy, and a little bloodshot.

name: Oxygen Mask
description: Highly flammable.  Proceed with caution.

name: Spoopy Mask
description: Somehow funny, and spooky, all at the same time, like a comedy about a ghost.

name: Volto Mask
description: Use this mask to find out exactly where the rainbow ends.

name: New Gauntlets
description: Fresh from the forge, so treat them right.

name: Shiny Gauntlets
description: Almost mirror-like, adventurers often confuse their enemies wearing these.

name: Plain Gauntlets
description: The exact opposite of The Everything Gauntlet.

name: Pristine Gauntlets
description: These gauntlets have never been touched, until now.

name: Challenge Gauntlets
description: Legend states that these mythical gauntlets are awarded to dragon raiders and cheese hoarders.

name: Fancy Gauntlets
description: For some reason, there's a spot for a gem on the thumb.  That's an odd choice.

name: Old Gauntlets
description: Particularly helpful when your wizards need food badly.

name: Dark Gauntlets
description: The color of these gauntlets baffle smiths and armorcrafters to this day.

name: Dandy Gauntlets
description: Often worn by process servers to deliver copyright disputes.

name: Cool Gauntlets
description: The top prize awarded to record holders for breaking misunderstood records.

name: Gardening Gloves
description: The thumbs are green, as you would expect.

name: Running Gloves
description: Chapped hands are a real problem, and these are the perfect solution.

name: Fighting Gloves
description: Ergonomically designed so you can snap while you sing.

name: Cleaning Gloves
description: Works great for scrubbing sinks or avoiding the hoi polloi.

name: Punching Gloves
description: The knuckles are padded with brass, which seems counterintuitive.

name: Hugging Gloves
description: Politicians wear these so that they don't actually have to touch the great unwashed.

name: Dancing Gloves
description: The fingers of these gloves are detachable, because sure, why not.

name: Loving Gloves
description: Ideally speaking, we should all wear gloves before going to bed.

name: Other Gloves
description: Named by an architect who had to come up with a last minute change.

name: Boxing Gloves
description: These gloves are the traditional gift given to children the day after Christmas.

name: Hamster Clogs
description: These wooden shoes are tiny, and have bits of romaine stuck inside.

name: Mage Moccasins
description: Staunch magical defenders used these in ancient times.

name: Druidic Boots
description: These boots have odd properties that allow it to change form quickly.

name: Fighting Stilettos
description: The perfect shoe for date night and stabbing people in the neck.

name: Bardic Galoshes
description: Smells like ale, and covered in syrup.

name: Master Loafers
description: Frequently worn around the house, they don't often see the light of day.

name: Foxy Slippers
description: One of them appears to have a chip.

name: Hairy Shoes
description: The best excuse to have a second breakfast.

name: Lunar Whalers
description: You aren't sure why, but wearing these makes you feel more energetic.

name: Jay Walkers
description: Upon closer inspection, it appears as if the artist has put their name all over these shoes.

name: Metal Armor
description: Provides strong protection, but limited mobility.

name: Metallic Armor
description: Just make sure you don't get sand in it.

name: Panther Armor
description: If this armor were any heavier, adventurers would collapse from the weight.

name: Slayers Plate
description: The history of this armor is mired in controversy.

name: Leaded Zeppelin Hull
description: Check out the newer version, the Greta Von Hauberk.

name: A Cool Dark Chainmail
description: Given the opportunity, you should paint the back in black or really dark grey.

name: Maidens Plate
description: Named after a torture device, this armor can cause hearing loss.

name: Intense Purple Cuirass
description: Not to be used as a floatation device.

name: Serpent Mail
description: Oddly useful at car washes.

name: Heavy Metal Armor
description: Somehow, this armor only allows one arm through.

name: Novice Cloak
description: A simple protective covering.

name: Apprentice Cloak
description: Worn by initiates looking to find more steady work.

name: Practitioner Cloak
description: It has a protective coating to prevent forest fires and accidental discharge.

name: Journeyman Cloak
description: Wandering magi wear it to harness the elements.

name: Expert Cloak
description: The most experienced spellcasters wear this cloak with pride.

name: Frostflinger Cloak
description: This garment is as cold as ice, but it's a sacrifice worth making for the power it gives.

name: Stormbringer Cloak
description: Made from flannel, it is especially deadly in the dry winter air.

name: Earthslinger Cloak
description: Comes with a hydrophobic coating, so you can cause destruction in style.

name: Lifegiver Cloak
description: It contains many pockets to hide remedies and antidotes for all occasions.

name: Deathcaller Cloak
description: Those who wear this cloak should be forewarned: this cloak may be cursed.

name: Mole Vest
description: Worn by those who hide in plain sight.

name: Assassin Vest
description: This vest allows the wearer to move silently.

name: Bandit Vest
description: Has a handy pocket to keep bandanas and knives.

name: Spy Vest
description: Also comes in black and white.

name: Fugitive Vest
description: Good for those on the run and trying to prove their innocence.

name: Outlaw Vest
description: Great for protecting against the elements while in exile.

name: Grifter Vest
description: When grifting someone, make sure they aren't broke, or well connected.

name: Criminal Vest
description: Designed by a soft spoken judge who understands criminals quite well.

name: Hitman Vest
description: Hitperson just doesn't sound right, but it's a gender neutral vest.

name: Pirate Vest
description: Contains a special shoulder attachment for parrots to perch on.

name: Patience
description: Sometimes the easiest way to win is to wait for your enemy to die.

name: Faithful Buckler
description: Seeing is believing, but blocking with this shield doesn't hurt either.

name: Defiant Targe
description: This shield will help you hold your ground, even in adverse situations.

name: Fair Shield
description: Fairness is okay as long as I get what I want.

name: Wisdom
description: Wisdom is knowing not to put tomatoes in a fruit salad.

name: Generous Blocker
description: Easily able to cover an adventurer and a half.

name: Loyal Companion
description: This shield is lined with fur, so it will keep you warm at night.

name: Dignity
description: The most luxurious possession and richest treasure most people will ever have.

name: Trustworthy Kite
description: Sometimes the best shield against harm is your own principles.

name: Truth Teller
description: One good hit to your enemy's skull should help them give up any secrets.

name: Stealth Ward
description: Useful in protecting against the unseen.

name: Sentry Ward
description: Alerts the user when dangery is nearby.

name: Spell Ward
description: Whiskey Alpha Romeo Delta

name: Curse Ward
description: Trusting the demon of lying to tell the truth was probably a mistake.

name: Poison Ward
description: Antidotes are much cheaper, but this ward will last forever.

name: Disease Ward
description: It will protect you against most common ailments adventurers face.

name: Infection Ward
description: Keep this ward around, but make sure to get your flu shot too.

name: Cancer Ward
description: If only this existed for real.

name: Maternity Ward
description: Using this ward will result in years of sleeplessness nights and reduced savings accounts.

name: Burn Unit
description: Not just for clapbacks anymore.

name: Stones
description: Not safe to own in houses made of glass.

name: Sticks
description: Don't shove this in your bike spokes.

name: Words
description: Use this against yourself before your enemies get the chance.

name: Shooting Stars
description: Protect yourself against bag raiders with a handful of these.

name: Poison Shuriken
description: A little poison will go a long way, so use it modestly.

name: Shining Stars
description: Manages to reflect light, even when covered in blood.

name: Golden Shuriken
description: This weapon broke the mold.  Throw for the moon.

name: Frost Shuriken
description: Consider it a really sharp chill pill.

name: Burning Sticks
description: All it takes is one match to start an explosion.

name: Heart Seeker
description: The fastest way to your enemy's heart is through his stomach, so aim for that.

name: Spells Vol I
description: An introduction into the wide world of magic.

name: Spells Vol II
description: Basic ingredients and techniques commonly used.

name: Spells Vol IV
description: Fun stories from former witches and warlocks.

name: Earthshaping and You
description: How to make your enemies dirty while staying squeaky clean.

name: Pyromania: A Love Story
description: How to make long distance relationships with magma elementals work.

name: Great Hamster Vol XXI
description: New for Vol XXI: a special section on salads and croutons

name: Nal'Dur's Diary
description: I'm so upset.  How can I be expected to end the world when I can't even get Tommy to notice me?

name: Cauldroning 101
description: A deep dive into best practices, but it is so dense most people don't know who the author is.

name: Secret Streams
description: Upon further review, it looks like a manual about divining rods.

name: Efficient Spells 102
description: The final volume from an outcast former expert.

name: Dubious Dart
description: You're not sure if it's really a dart, or a fat arrow.

name: Delayed Dart
description: It's really noticable when the latency rates go up.

name: Diverted Dart
description: Seems to have taken a detour to Albuquerque.

name: Ditched Dart
description: It moves so quick, that this dart forgets to pay the bill.

name: Ducked Dart
description: Quite useful during rabbit season.

name: Dipped Dart
description: Thirty years ago, this was called the dart of the future.  Since then, nothing has changed.

name: Dancing Dart
description: A classic dart beloved by many, but is highly problematic looking back on it now.

name: Daring Dart
description: The courage to make the right move at the right time is everything.

name: Double Dart
description: Two times the pain packed into one easy to handle dart.

name: Dodged Dart
description: It doesn't look like much, but it gets to point A to point B just fine.

name: Healing Potion
description: A simple concoction to soothe wounds.

name: Mana Potion
description: The standard recovery method mages use.

name: Sleeping Potion
description: Not for long-term use.  Designed by Melvin Albert Tonin.

name: Coughing Potion
description: After two or three of these, most adventurers are ready for a long nap.

name: Invincibility Potion
description: The bottle looks completely transparent, but that's pretty self-explanatory.

name: Laughing Potion
description: Consuming many of these at once is called a smorgasvein, and it's elegantly cultural.

name: Rejuvenating Potion
description: Traditionally recovers health over time.

name: Like Potion
description: Created by a gold-toothed gypsy, who later created an even more famous potion.

name: Bitter Potion
description: Using this potion by the light of the moon may lead to broken cups and abrupt endings.

name: Strength Potion
description: In some regions, this potion contains highly illegal, and addictive, ingredients.

name: Lactuca
description: The beloved pendant of vegetarians and vegans.

name: Gelata Eros
description: A little sticky, and a little nutty, but it makes everyone jealous.

name: Comitatus
description: Created in fertile farmland where great adventures seem to begin.

name: Tacet Gladio
description: Walk softly, and carry a big stick to impale your adversaries with.

name: Ostium Amici
description: Manly men in northern regions are particularly suited for this pendant.

name: Ignis Pullum
description: Contains the feather of an resurrected avian creature.

name: Folium Strennus
description: Used by only the most impassioned adventurers.

name: Magicae Criceta
description: This pendant looks good, and works amazingly well.

name: Inpulsa Sciurus
description: Wearing this trinket bestows a sense of pride and accomplishment.

name: Adipem Pater
description: If this pendant could lose some weight, it would be far more useful.

name: Soldier Ring
description: The soldiers soldered this ring themselves.

name: Mercenary Ring
description: This ring signifies that the wearer holds no allegiances.

name: Chaplain Ring
description: Adorned with certain etchings that make it unmistakable.

name: General Ring
description: Gifted to the most prestigious of generals upon retirement.

name: Tactical Ring
description: Might be a decoder ring, but it's hard to tell.

name: Paladin Ring
description: Contains a small amount of holy water, just in case.

name: Hunter Ring
description: Worn to show prowess and cunning in battle.

name: Trapper Ring
description: Signifies a commitment to a difficult and taxing profession.

name: Berserker Ring
description: The love for this ring is like a ticking clock.

name: Marksman Ring
description: Holds some secrets shown to be invaluable to the most skilled sharpshooters.

name: Conch Shell
description: These wash up on shore, and produce lovely sounds.

name: Flute
description: A simple, well-known instrument.

name: Harp
description: Once considered to be the most valueable of all crafted items, it has since fallen out of favor.

name: Guitar Pick
description: Always seems to get stuck in things at the worst possible moment.

name: Flugelhorn
description: Slightly more tolerable than a vuvuzela.

name: Drum
description: Used to inspire troops to march heroicly into battle.

name: Lyre
description: Very popular on campuses.  Used by bachelors in awkward courtship rituals.

name: Bells
description: Used to inspire troops by running away from the annoying sound it creates.

name: Shofar
description: Most often used to warn villagers of an incoming raid.

name: Gjallarhorn
description: The horn of legend, it represents the pinnacle of music-making.

name: Leather Belt
description: Keeps your pants up.

name: Timing Belt
description: Make sure to wear this belt at just the right moment.

name: Rodeo Belt
description: Awarded to the best in competition.

name: Rust Belt
description: Once worn by skilled laborers, many years ago.

name: Cowboy Belt
description: The gawdy buckle is supposed to signify wealth.

name: Flat Belt
description: This belt has been left out in the open for way too long.

name: Fan Belt
description: For some reason, this belt is constantly oscillating.

name: Formal Belt
description: Matches perfectly with business socks, for business time.

name: Conveyor Belt
description: The leather in this belt was orginally used in a pulley system.

name: Extra Belt
description: This belt is just way over the top.  Entirely too much going on.

name: Magic Earring
description: The perfect combination of stylish and cute.

name: Druidic Earring
description: Adored by nature lovers the world over.

name: Musical Earring
description: On quiet nights, some say this earring creates it's own music.  It could be tinnitus.

name: Caster Earring
description: The perfect earring for those who fish.  Can be used as a lure in a pinch.

name: Medical Earring
description: Houses a small device that alerts paramedics, should you ever fall and can't get up.

name: Healing Earring
description: Sold primarily by trendy merchants who claim crystals and oils can cure curious ailments.

name: Wizard Earring
description: Wearing this earring for prolonged periods may empower you to learn a long forgotten language.

name: Clerical Earring
description: Loved by those who make spreadsheets and do data entry.

name: Charismatic Earring
description: Favored by those who want to talk their way out of a tough situation.

name: Rose Earring
description: The idyllic earring, perfect in every way.

name: Nail
description: Try not to get too hammered.

name: Lumber
description: Made from the knottiest pine.

name: Shingle
description: You should put a ring on it.

name: Beam
description: Don't cross them.

name: Insulation
description: Protects against solar radiation.

name: Vault
description: Security not guaranteed.

name: Frame
description: It wasn't me, I swear.

name: Wall
description: All in all, it's another brick.

name: Roof
description: Keep your overheads low.

name: Bank
description: Store your precious keepsakes here.

name: Sturdy Nail
description: Try not to get too hammered.

name: Sturdy Lumber
description: Made from the knottiest pine.

name: Sturdy Shingle
description: You should put a ring on it.

name: Sturdy Beam
description: Don't cross them.

name: Sturdy Insulation
description: Protects against solar radiation.

name: Cauldron
description: Think of it as a really big crock pot.

name: Sturdy Frame
description: It wasn't me, I swear.
